column3: ACK, one unrelated thing can you explain what FIRST_CLASS_MESSAGING is or does for us UI wise?\n

Basically, it makes that sign/verify message are tabs instead of separate windows. lukejr introduced it in one of his commits, because according to him signmessage is as important (and thus should be as prominent) as sending coins, but I don't think anyone apart from him agrees and/or uses the feature.\n

I have a pull in the pipe that merges sign / verify message to a tabbed UI just like with the options dialog. Will open it later today or tomorrow ... perhaps we can talk about removing that unused stuff? Are there any comparison screens how it looks with that messaging stuff? That many #ifdefs for such a thing annoy me!\n
I don't think there is a need to do that, better to keep it like this, it will only result in endless bikeshedding discussions. \n
